centralQuestion: Should term limits be introduced for Senators?

reasons.description: Reduce incumbency entrenchment and careerism by ensuring regular turnover and a 'citizen legislature.'

sources.title: The Wall Street Journal: 'Make the Senate Great Again'
Politico: 'How to Fix Politics: Term limits'
Brookings Institution: 'Limiting Terms of Office for Members of the U.S. Senate and U.S. House of Representatives'

reasons.description: Curb special-interest influence by reducing incentives to build long-term fundraising networks and insider ties.

sources.title: Politico: 'How to Fix Politics: Term limits'

reasons.description: Reflect widespread public demand for limits on tenure in high office, signaling democratic responsiveness.

sources.title: Pew Research Center: 'How Americans view proposals to change the political system'

objections.description: Term limits restrict voter choice by preventing constituents from reelecting preferred representatives.

sources.title: Brookings Institution: 'Five reasons to oppose congressional term limits'

objections.description: Loss of experience and expertise can weaken the legislature and empower lobbyists and the executive.

sources.title: Stanford Hoover Institution: 'How California’s term limits failed the people'

objections.description: Evidence suggests term limits can reduce legislative productivity and institutional capacity.

sources.title: The Washington Post: 'How term limits for committee chairs make Congress less effective'

objections.description: State-level experience shows unintended consequences like greater partisanship and reduced effectiveness.

research.title: 'Legislative Term Limits and Polarization' (The Journal of Politics, 2020)
research.description: Analyzes U.S. state legislatures and argues that term limits increase party polarization by changing career incentives and strengthening party roles.

research.title: 'On the Outside Looking In: Lobbyists’ Perspectives on the Effects of State Legislative Term Limits' (State Politics & Policy Quarterly, 2001)
research.description: Survey of lobbyists in term-limited states finds influence shifts away from legislatures toward governors, agencies, and interest groups under term limits.

research.title: 'The Limited Impact of Term Limits: Contingent Effects on the Complexity and Breadth of Laws' (State Politics & Policy Quarterly, 2006)
research.description: Studies multiple states before/after reform and finds term limits can reduce policy complexity in some legislatures, with mixed effects depending on professionalism.

research.title: 'Do Term Limits Restrain State Fiscal Policy? Approaches for Studying Institutional Effects' (Legislative Studies Quarterly, 2013)
research.description: Assesses whether term-limited states face greater fiscal stress; outlines methods and presents evidence on budgetary consequences of term limits.

research.title: 'The Effect of State Legislative Term Limits on Voter Turnout' (State Politics & Policy Quarterly, 2007)
research.description: Examines California races and finds that, contrary to reformers’ hopes, term limits can decrease voter turnout.
